snippet: The demolition of a historic house in the imperial city, once home to famous architects who championed historic preservation, is a cruel blow to conservationists.
abstract: Architectural preservationists in Beijing are outraged by the unannounced and furtive government demolition of a house once occupied by famed architects Liang Sicheng and Lin Huiyin, champions of historic preservation; government officials tell the state news media, which was sharp in its criticism of the demolition, that a replica of the historic home will be built.
lead_paragraph: The demolition of a historic house in the imperial city, once home to famous architects who championed historic preservation, is a cruel blow to conservationists.

headline.seo: Historic Status Offers No Protection in Beijing
headline.main: In Beijing’s Building Frenzy, Even an ‘Immovable Cultural Relic’ Is Not Safe
headline.print_headline: In Beijing’s Building Frenzy, Even an ‘Immovable Cultural Relic’ Is Not Safe
